--- Page 1 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2022/0527 b) Date of Occurrence: 30/09/2023
c) Installation Details: Minotaur Heavy - AC-6561-821 at
Regional Depot-A
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Propulsion b) Date Component 07/10/2023
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Engine Control d) Main Assembly: Pylon-B
e) Nomenclature: Engine Control Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: MOD-C
g) Part No.: PR-8252-G6 h) Sl No.: SN-1706-442
i) Firmware Version: Not Applicable j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 02/09/2020 l) Date of Removal: 05/10/2023
Pg No: 97 Ln No: 21 Pg No: 56 Ln No: 24
m) Manufacturing Agency: Omega Flight Technologies n) Date, Month & Year November 2020
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: No p) Whether under AMC Yes
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 565 Hrs / 428 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Minor
b) Defect Observed: Fuel nozzle blockage. Issue identified during pre-flight checks.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Age-related degradation of elastomeric components
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Engine Control component. Physical
examination revealed signs of wear and degradation.
c) Remedial Measures Clean and re-lubricate affected assemblies per technical manual
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Enhance operator training on proper usage procedures
d) Attributable Code: N2 - Defect Not Confirmed
Remarks: Complete defect analysis performed. Lessons learned documented.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Design assessment confirms component operated within specified limits. Recommend enhanced inspection protocol.
Date: 30/10/2023 Authorized Signatory of Design: Dr. A.K. Sharma

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Quality aspects reviewed. Manufacturing process controls are adequate. Recommend supplier quality audit.
Date: 02/11/2023 Signature: Sqn Ldr H.S. Bhatia
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
Fleet experience reviewed. Similar occurrences noted on other platforms. Support fleet-wide inspection.
Date: 02/11/2023 Signature: Air Cmde S.B. Rao
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
Regulatory quality requirements verified. Proposed actions meet airworthiness standards. Recommend approval.
Date: 06/11/2023 Signature: Air Cmde S.B. Rao
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Design aspects reviewed from certification authority perspective. Investigation is thorough and conclusions are sound.
Date: 04/11/2023 Signature: Wg Cdr B.P. Gupta
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
